name: Icon + Toggle list
description: Displays a list of items where each has its own state that can be individually controlled with a toggle switch. This is ideal for managing multiple settings or devices from a single screen, such as app notifications, system functions (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth), or smart home device controls.
examples: Turn on notifications and turn off location services.
Show me only the devices that are currently on.
Turn on the AC and turn off the TV.
List all the devices in the living room.

component_title.description: A brief title for the entire list of controls (e.g., 'Settings', 'Device Control').

toggle_list.description: An array of controllable items to be displayed in the list.

icon.description: The path to the icon representing the setting or device (e.g., a Wi-Fi symbol, a lightbulb icon).

text_subject.description: The name of the setting or device (e.g., 'Wi-Fi', 'Living Room Lamp').

status.description: The current state of the item. `true` for on, `false` for off. This controls the toggle's position.
